folder: Amboy Road & Huguenot Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Memorial Church of the Huguenots.
This photograph taken while the church was under construction, sometime prior to its 1924 dedication.

48x482. Acquired from N.Y. Herald Tribune morgue, 1947.

folder: Huguenot Avenue & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
Huguenot Avenue, adjoining the N.W. corner of Amboy Road, showing the Huguenot branch of the New York Public Library.
1923
P. L. Sperr,

folder: Huguenot Avenue & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
885 Huguenot Avenue, east side, north of Amboy Road, showing the Huguenot Station of the United States Post Office.
1924
P. L. Sperr

folder: Amboy Road & Huguenot Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Amboy Road, west of the N.W. corner of Huguenot Ave., showing the Eugcenot Park Reformed Church. It was dedicated on May 16, 1924, as a National monument to the Huguenot settlers of America. For additional information see Staten Island and its People by Leng
and Davis, vol. 1, p 442.
September 24, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the church, looking eastward.
September 24, 1930.
P. L. S9err.

folder: Huguenot Avenue & Amboy Road, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Huguenot Avenue, west side, between Amboy Road and Pleasant Plains Boulevard, showing Our Lady Star of the Sea Roman Catholic Church.

(2)

Sept. 24, 1930.
